title: Immunizations For Respiratory Viruses Prevention
content:
get an RSV vaccine.
To prevent severe RSV disease in infants, CDC recommends either the pregnant mother gets an RSV vaccine, or the infant gets an immunization with an RSV monoclonal antibody. Most infants will not need both.
When making a vaccination plan, consider getting more than one vaccine at once. Flu, COVID-19, and RSV vaccines can be given at the same visit.
